verse: This is a ·message [prophecy; oracle; burden] about Tyre [port city in Phoenicia, north of Israel; present-day Lebanon]:
·At that time [In that day] Tyre will be forgotten for seventy years, which is the length of a king’s life. ·After [At the end of] seventy years, Tyre will be like the prostitute in this song:
·After [At the end of] seventy years the Lord will ·deal with [visit] Tyre, and it will again ·have trade [earn wages]. It will be like a prostitute for all the ·nations [kingdoms] of the earth.

The profits will be ·saved [set apart; holy] for the Lord. Tyre will not ·keep [store up or hoard] the money she earns but will give them to the people who ·serve [worship; dwell before] the Lord, so they will have plenty of food and ·nice clothes [beautiful coverings].
